intro: Anthericum guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan lily, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces a cluster of small, bell-shaped blooms at the top of the stem, which are often fragrant. Its leaves are long, narrow, and grass-like, forming a dense rosette at the base. Anthericum guatemalense is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
